description: ACE (Advanced Cybersecurity Execution) Team v7 - MITRE ATT&CK Specialized Agent Architecture
label: ACE RedTeam Swarm v7 - MITRE Aligned

participants.description: Red Team Lead - Strategic coordinator and mission commander
participants.label: Red Team Lead

config.name: red_team_lead

handoffs.description: Delegate reconnaissance and target enumeration tasks
handoffs.name: request_reconnaissance
handoffs.message: RECONNAISSANCE REQUEST: Conduct information gathering and target enumeration with specified scope and objectives.

handoffs.description: Request payload generation and infrastructure setup
handoffs.name: request_resource_development
handoffs.message: RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT REQUEST: Generate payloads, setup infrastructure, or prepare exploitation tools.

handoffs.description: Execute initial access and exploitation attempts
handoffs.name: request_initial_access
handoffs.message: INITIAL ACCESS REQUEST: Attempt to gain initial foothold using specified attack vectors and targets.

handoffs.description: Conduct internal network and system discovery
handoffs.name: request_discovery
handoffs.message: DISCOVERY REQUEST: Enumerate internal systems, services, and network topology.

handoffs.name: request_execution_credentials
handoffs.message: EXECUTION/CREDENTIAL REQUEST: Execute commands or harvest credentials from compromised systems.

handoffs.description: Monitor system health and manage processes
handoffs.name: request_system_monitoring
handoffs.message: MONITORING REQUEST: Check system health, manage processes, or collect telemetry data.

handoffs.description: Conduct OSINT research and web-based intelligence gathering
handoffs.name: request_web_research
handoffs.message: WEB RESEARCH REQUEST: Conduct OSINT research, gather intelligence from public sources, or verify information online.

model_context.description: An unbounded chat completion context that keeps a view of the all the messages.
model_context.label: UnboundedChatCompletionContext

config.description: Strategic mission commander with MITRE ATT&CK orchestration
config.system_message: You are the Red Team Lead coordinating a MITRE ATT&CK-aligned specialist team. RULES OF ENGAGEMENT: Aggressive and investigative approach, all activities logged. Your workflow: 1) ANALYZE OBJECTIVES: Understand mission goals and target scope 2) TACTICAL PLANNING: Map objectives to MITRE ATT&CK tactics and select appropriate specialists 3) COORDINATE SPECIALISTS: Delegate tasks to specialized agents based on MITRE tactics 4) SYNTHESIZE RESULTS: Combine specialist reports into actionable intelligence 5) FINAL SUMMARY: Create comprehensive markdown assessment report with methodology, findings, and recommendations. SPECIALIST HANDOFFS: Use Reconnaissance (TA0043) for target enumeration, Resource Development (TA0042) for payload creation, Initial Access (TA0001) for exploitation, Discovery (TA0007) for internal enumeration, Execution/Credentials (TA0002/TA0006) for post-exploitation, System Monitoring for operational support, Web Research for OSINT. CRITICAL: When objectives are achieved, create a detailed markdown summary including: Executive Summary, Methodology Used, Key Findings, Attack Timeline, Compromised Assets, Recommendations, and Lessons Learned. End with 'TERMINATE' when complete.

config.name: reconnaissance_specialist

workbench.description: HexStrike Reconnaissance MCP - Information gathering and target enumeration
workbench.label: Reconnaissance MCP

handoffs.description: Report reconnaissance findings to Red Team Lead
handoffs.name: report_reconnaissance_results
handoffs.message: RECONNAISSANCE COMPLETE: Target enumeration and information gathering results with discovered assets, services, and vulnerabilities.

model_context.description: An unbounded chat completion context that keeps a view of the all the messages.
model_context.label: UnboundedChatCompletionContext

config.description: Information gathering and target enumeration specialist
config.system_message: You are the Reconnaissance Specialist (MITRE ATT&CK TA0043). Your mission: gather information about targets before and during operations. When receiving reconnaissance requests: 1) ACKNOWLEDGE: Confirm reconnaissance scope and objectives 2) EXECUTE RECONNAISSANCE: Use Nmap, Gobuster, Nuclei, Ffuf, Feroxbuster, Hakrawler, ParamSpider, CVE monitoring tools 3) ANALYZE FINDINGS: Identify high-value targets, services, vulnerabilities, and attack surfaces 4) REPORT RESULTS: Provide structured intelligence with prioritized targets and recommended next steps. Focus on OSINT, active scanning, vulnerability identification, and attack surface mapping.

participants.description: Resource Development Specialist - MITRE ATT&CK TA0042
participants.label: Resource Development Specialist

config.name: resource_development_specialist

handoffs.description: Report resource development completion to Red Team Lead
handoffs.name: report_resource_development_results
handoffs.message: RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT COMPLETE: Payloads generated, infrastructure prepared, and tools configured for operational use.

model_context.description: An unbounded chat completion context that keeps a view of the all the messages.
model_context.label: UnboundedChatCompletionContext

config.description: Payload generation and infrastructure setup specialist
config.system_message: You are the Resource Development Specialist (MITRE ATT&CK TA0042). Your mission: establish resources to support operations. When receiving resource development requests: 1) ACKNOWLEDGE: Confirm resource requirements and specifications 2) DEVELOP RESOURCES: Create files, generate payloads (buffer, cyclic, shellcode), use MSFVenom, AI payload generation, install Python packages, execute scripts 3) CUSTOMIZE TOOLS: Adapt payloads for specific targets and evasion requirements 4) REPORT COMPLETION: Provide resource inventory and usage instructions. Focus on malware development, exploit creation, infrastructure setup, and operational tool preparation.

participants.description: Initial Access Specialist - MITRE ATT&CK TA0001
participants.label: Initial Access Specialist

config.name: initial_access_specialist

workbench.description: HexStrike Initial Access MCP - Exploitation and entry point tools
workbench.label: Initial Access MCP

handoffs.description: Report initial access attempts and results to Red Team Lead
handoffs.name: report_initial_access_results
handoffs.message: INITIAL ACCESS COMPLETE: Exploitation attempts executed with success/failure status, compromised systems, and established footholds.

model_context.description: An unbounded chat completion context that keeps a view of the all the messages.
model_context.label: UnboundedChatCompletionContext

config.system_message: You are the Initial Access Specialist (MITRE ATT&CK TA0001). Your mission: gain initial foothold in target systems. When receiving initial access requests: 1) ACKNOWLEDGE: Confirm targets and attack vectors 2) EXECUTE ATTACKS: Use SQLMap, XSSer, Wfuzz, DotDotPwn, API fuzzing, GraphQL scanning, Burp Suite, ZAP, AI payload testing 3) VALIDATE ACCESS: Confirm successful exploitation and establish persistence 4) REPORT RESULTS: Document compromised systems, access levels, and recommended next steps. Focus on web application attacks, API exploitation, and public-facing service compromise.

workbench.label: Discovery MCP

handoffs.description: Report discovery findings to Red Team Lead

handoffs.message: DISCOVERY COMPLETE: Internal network enumeration and system discovery results with identified assets, services, and lateral movement opportunities.

model_context.description: An unbounded chat completion context that keeps a view of the all the messages.
model_context.label: UnboundedChatCompletionContext

config.description: Internal network and system enumeration specialist
config.system_message: You are the Discovery Specialist (MITRE ATT&CK TA0007). Your mission: gather information about the internal environment. When receiving discovery requests: 1) ACKNOWLEDGE: Confirm discovery scope and objectives 2) ENUMERATE SYSTEMS: Use NetExec, SMBMap, file listing, WPScan, API schema analysis, comprehensive API audits 3) MAP ENVIRONMENT: Identify network topology, services, applications, and potential lateral movement paths 4) REPORT FINDINGS: Provide network maps, service inventories, and prioritized targets for further exploitation. Focus on system discovery, network share enumeration, and service identification.

participants.description: Execution & Credential Access Specialist - MITRE ATT&CK TA0002/TA0006
participants.label: Execution & Credential Access Specialist

config.name: execution_credential_specialist

workbench.label: Execution & Credential Access MCP

handoffs.name: report_execution_credential_results
handoffs.message: EXECUTION/CREDENTIAL ACCESS COMPLETE: Commands executed and credentials harvested with access levels, extracted data, and privilege escalation opportunities.

model_context.description: An unbounded chat completion context that keeps a view of the all the messages.
model_context.label: UnboundedChatCompletionContext

config.description: Command execution and credential harvesting specialist
config.system_message: You are the Execution & Credential Access Specialist (MITRE ATT&CK TA0002/TA0006). Your mission: execute code and harvest credentials on compromised systems. When receiving execution/credential requests: 1) ACKNOWLEDGE: Confirm execution targets and credential objectives 2) EXECUTE OPERATIONS: Use Metasploit, command execution, HTTP repeater, Hashcat, JWT analysis, credential harvesting, Mimikatz simulation, browser credential extraction 3) HARVEST CREDENTIALS: Extract passwords, hashes, tokens, and authentication materials 4) REPORT RESULTS: Document executed commands, harvested credentials, and privilege escalation opportunities. Focus on post-exploitation activities and credential acquisition.

model_context.label: UnboundedChatCompletionContext

config.description: System health monitoring and process management specialist
config.system_message: You are the System Monitoring Specialist providing operational support. Your mission: maintain system health and manage operational processes. When receiving monitoring requests: 1) ACKNOWLEDGE: Confirm monitoring scope and requirements 2) MONITOR SYSTEMS: Check server health, cache statistics, telemetry collection, process management, dashboard generation 3) MANAGE PROCESSES: List, monitor, terminate, pause, or resume processes as needed 4) REPORT STATUS: Provide system health reports, performance metrics, and operational recommendations. Focus on maintaining operational security and system performance during red team exercises.

participants.description: An agent that solves tasks by browsing the web using a headless browser.
participants.label: Web Surfer Agent

config.name: websurfer_agent

handoffs.description: Report web research findings to Red Team Lead
handoffs.name: report_web_research_results
handoffs.message: WEB RESEARCH COMPLETE: OSINT findings, intelligence gathered from public sources, and verified information with actionable insights.

config.description: OSINT and web-based intelligence gathering specialist
config.system_message: You are the Web Research Specialist conducting OSINT and web-based intelligence gathering. When receiving web research requests: 1) ACKNOWLEDGE: Confirm research objectives and scope 2) CONDUCT RESEARCH: Search for target information, company details, employee data, technology stacks, vulnerabilities, breach data, and public exposure 3) VERIFY INFORMATION: Cross-reference findings across multiple sources 4) REPORT RESULTS: Provide structured intelligence with source citations and confidence levels. Focus on gathering actionable intelligence that supports red team operations while maintaining operational security.

participants.description: An agent that can represent a human user through an input function.
participants.label: UserProxyAgent

config.name: user_proxy
config.description: a human user that should be consulted only when the assistant_agent is unable to verify the information provided by the websurfer_agent

conditions.description: Terminate when Red Team Lead confirms objectives achieved
conditions.label: TextMentionTermination

conditions.description: Safety net - terminate after 100 messages for complex operations
conditions.label: MaxMessageTermination
